pullRequest.body: Hopefully this would have given us an earlier heads-up about the recent lean4checker problem.

### PR summary [0793a2fd16](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19735/commits/0793a2fd1629b10a8ba7d059b0177ffdca6a65ae)

#### Import changes for modified files

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Is this missing the commit with `lean4checker_nightly.yml`?

> Is this missing the commit with `lean4checker_nightly.yml`?

Thanks, pushed now.

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I've updated this to combine the two files.

```suggestion
```
This was removed from the `bors.yml` / `build.yml` in #19729. I suspect we can remove it here (and in `lean4checker.yml`) too.

```suggestion
```
I think this will be somewhat easier to maintain if we preserve the order of corresponding steps between the two files (not sure if I've done it properly here).

```suggestion

      - name: Fetch latest tags
        run: |
          git fetch --tags
          # Find the most recent tag matching the pattern
          LATEST_TAG=$(git tag | grep -E '^nightly-testing-[0-9]{4}-[0-9]{2}-[0-9]{2}$' | sort -r | head -n 1)
          echo "LATEST_TAG=\"${LATEST_TAG}\"" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"

      - name: Checkout latest tag branch
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          ref: ${{ env.LATEST_TAG }}

```
Moving these steps to preserve the order between files.

pullRequest.title: chore: run lean4checker on most recent nightly-testing-YYYY-MM-DD tag
